text: Peter Karlsson (born 23 November 1970 in GothenburgSports-Reference profile) is a retired Swedish athlete who competed in the sprinting events. He is best known for winning the bronze medal in the 60 metres at the 1996 European Indoor Championships in his native Sweden. In addition, he competed at the 1996 Summer Olympics, as well as 1995 and 1997 World Championships. He is the Swedish record holder in the 100 meter dash with 10.18, as well as co-holder of the indoor 60 meter record of 6.58, together with Patrik Lövgren. In 1996, Peter ran 100 meter in 9.98 although with a tailwind of 4.0 m/s, which is beyond the legal limit of 2.0 m/s.All-Athletics profile ==Competition record== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |rowspan=2|1994 |rowspan=2|European Championships |rowspan=2|Helsinki, Finland |7th (sf) |100 m |10.41 (wind: +1.7 m/s) |- |4th |4x100m relay |39.05 |- |rowspan=2|1995 |rowspan=2|World Championships |rowspan=2|Gothenburg, Sweden |25th (qf) |100 m |10.39 |- |9th (sf) |4x100 m relay |38.78Disqualified in the final |- |rowspan=3|1996 |European Indoor Championships |Stockholm, Sweden |bgcolor=cc9966|3rd |60 m |6.64 |- |rowspan=2|Olympic Games |rowspan=2|Atlanta, United States |17th (qf) |100 m |10.24 |- |5th |4x100 m relay |38.67 |- |rowspan=2|1997 |rowspan=2|World Championships |rowspan=2|Athens, Greece |40th (qf) |100 m |10.40 |- |12th (sf) |4x100 m relay |39.04 |- |rowspan=2|1998 |European Indoor Championships |Valencia, Spain |17th (h) |60 m |6.70 |- |European Championships |Budapest, Hungary |6th |4x100 m relay |39.32 |} ==Personal bests== Outdoor *100 metres – 10.18 (0.0 m/s) (Cottbus 1996) NR *200 metres – 21.31 (+2.0 m/s) (Stockholm 1993) Indoor *60 metres – 6.58 (Gent 1996) NR ==References== Category:1970 births Category:Living people Category:Swedish male sprinters Category:Sportspeople from Gothenburg Category:Olympic athletes of Sweden Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1996 Summer Olympics
